answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The symptom described by you could be due to neuropathy. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. Discuss these options with your consulting doctor.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: Hi,I have a problem of ear canal Paraesthesia for 9 months now. It started with a simple sensation of touching of the inside of the ear   only when quiet or not talking and stops when I talk or move my Jaw. Sometimes it increases in frequency and sometimes I have a hot sensation in the ear. All the symptoms are just mild in nature. MRI and CT scan were normal. Not dizzy and hearing is OK. Even the seventh nerve as per the MRI is OK.Please share your thoughts about a possible cause.Regards
title: Ear canal sensation like paraesthesia
